domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

In 2000, UK Govt pledged 90% of growing media to be peat free by 2010.

In 2010, it calls for a complete phase out of peat by 2020.

In 2021, peat-based compost is set to be banned the government will announce this week.

This time, make it happen @DefraGovUK https://t.co/NXCPMU13tX

Every year, more people die from unsafe #water than from all forms of violence, including war.
#Tiredearth https://t.co/bravuefX0u

Only @DefraGovUK @MPGeorgeEustice @MattHancock can help stop the health harms now #stopthestink https://t.co/0NAWRzJ7ce

tweets.text: @davemh72 @poppers82 @tayz_BETH @StinkStopthe @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyMids @ClareDinnisEA @MPGeorgeEustice @DefraGovUK @stopthestink It all depends on the wind direction. When it‚Äôs not in your home: the wind is carrying it away and into someone else‚Äôs home, be it 1 or 6 miles away. The toxic stench is always there. WE MUST NEVER FORGET THIS. So basically...If I sleep well  some other poor soul is not! Unite...

And the @EnvAgency does what exactly?

https://t.co/neO7mzoVRf

At this point when the @EnvAgency have clearly said they have no money to fix the out of control landfill to me it becomes the governments responsibility to step in. @AaronBell4NUL is taking it to Parliament again next week.Surely there will be clear actions/timelines from that? https://t.co/HuvlrNDGHl

And so here we go again in the Thistleberry area of #NewcastleunderLyme - same time of day again at a weekend. Windows closed but it's getting in. This needs emergency action @MattHancock @StinkStopthe #stopthestink @ClareDinnisEA - why aren't you acting? It is getting worse here

#BuryStEdmunds https://t.co/TLxeNKReEV

You may not be startled to hear that Thames Water has informed us that they are discharging sewage into the river from the #Chesham Sewage Treatment Works following this afternoon's rain. Please keep out of the river downstream of Blackwell Hall #pollution #sewage #chalkstreams https://t.co/MX8ayAPbC8

Nothing but damage, pain and destruction being caused. I don‚Äôt even get a reference number these days when email.. @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK #poisinousgas #stopthestink #stopthegas @EnvAgency https://t.co/sv4rWIXnl4
@SoTCityCouncil @AbiBrown1 please spell check your official documents ' please click hear to report any issues' @StinkStopthe https://t.co/j8eKOmELmn

As @TonyJuniper makes clear - the nitrates & phosphates crisis needs joint solutions and effective leadership from both governments, the @EnvAgency, @NaturalEngland & @NatResWales, farmers and the water companies but as @joecrowley rightly concludes... who will lead that charge?

An assessment by @EnvAgency of the Wye, estimates the chief source of pollution (~60%+) is agricultural and waste water from existing homes (~25%). Sustainable house builder @MerryAlbright has estimated new homes on the Wye contribute less than 1% of phosphate loading.
